How to Install libatk-adaptor on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libatk-adaptor

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libatk-adaptor on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libatk-adaptor on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libatk-adaptor in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libatk-adaptor, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libatk-adaptor Using apt

To install libatk-adaptor in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libatk-adaptor using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libatk-adaptor

The installation of libatk-adaptor might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libatk-adaptor Using apt-get

To install libatk-adaptor using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libatk-adaptor.

sudo apt-get -y install libatk-adaptor

Install libatk-adaptor Using Synaptic

To install libatk-adaptor using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libatk-adaptor on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libatk-adaptor. This will display the libatk-adaptor package in the package window, now to install libatk-adaptor, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libatk-adaptor package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libatk-adaptor.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libatk-adaptor Using aptitude

To install libatk-adaptor on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libatk-adaptor.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libatk-adaptor using the command aptitude install libatk-adaptor.

sudo aptitude -y install libatk-adaptor

How to Upgrade libatk-adaptor on debian

If you want to upgrade the libatk-adaptor package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libatk-adaptor using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libatk-adaptor to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libatk-adaptor.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libatk-adaptor sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libatk-adaptor

Upgrade libatk-adaptor using Aptitude

To upgrade libatk-adaptor using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libatk-adaptor.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libatk-adaptor

Upgrade libatk-adaptor using Synaptic

To upgrade libatk-adaptor using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libatk-adaptor, now right-click libatk-adaptor, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libatk-adaptor just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libatk-adaptor on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libatk-adaptor from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libatk-adaptor, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libatk-adaptor

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libatk-adaptor

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libatk-adaptor you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libatk-adaptor

Remove libatk-adaptor using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libatk-adaptor using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libatk-adaptor, right-click the libatk-adaptor package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libatk-adaptor click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libatk-adaptor on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libatk-adaptor using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libatk-adaptor then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
